page.title: 16The Cheshire Home Gt.Bromley
page.content: The first{Cheshire Homes}were set up after{World War 2 (1939-1945)},when many people had nowhere to live and could not look after themselves.Local people began leaving food outside for them.The number of people doing this grew until there was enough support to build a home. There are now{50 homes } like this in the U.K.,named after {Group Captain Leonard Cheshire}. The Captain was an R.A.F. pilot in World War 2, who was present when the{1st {atomic bomb}was dropped on{Hiroshima,} {Japan}.After the war he dedicated his life to caring for people. In the home at Gt.Bromley there are{28 residents and 48 staff.We interviewed one of the residents who was blind and has had Multiple Sclerosis since she was 25.She is now 76. Hamilton Lodge-a home for the{mentally {handicapped}is also in Great Bromley.
